body:
Use this form to request personal information about someone from Her Majesty's Prison and Probation Service.

This service is also available in Welsh (Cymraeg).

## How long will it take ##

Submitting a request should take around 5 minutes.

So we can give you the best service, you should be as specific as possible about the information you need.

components.html: We aim to respond to all requests within a month. Do not ask for an update before this point as it may delay your request.

## Before you start ##

You will need to provide some personal details to help us process your request, such as your name, and date of birth.

You will also be asked for details relating to your request, such as the location of a probation office or the date of any court cases. The more information you can provide, the quicker we will be able to respond to your request.

You will also need: 

* photo ID, such as a passport or driving licence 
* proof of address, such a bank statement or utility bill dated in the last 3 months 
* If you are requesting information about someone else, photo ID and proof of address for that person plus a signed letter of consent from them
* If you are a solicitor, you will only need a signed letter of consent

extraComponents.html:
## Other ways to make a request ##

### Offenders and ex-offenders including prisoners ###

If you are representing an offender or prisoner or former prisoner and want to make a subject access request on their behalf for a copy of personal information held by Her Majestyâ€™s Prison and Probation Service, send your request by post, ensuring that you include ID to:

Branston Registry
Building 16, S & T Store
Burton Road
Branston
Burton-on-Trent
Staffordshire
DE14 3EG

or email: <data.access1@justice.gov.uk>

### Members of the public and court users ###

(INSERT TEXT HERE)

Disclosure Team
Post point 10.25
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

or email: <data.access@justice.gov.uk>

heading: Request personal information
